item.title: Shootaround (April 21) -- Isaiah Thomas should suit up for Game 3 tonight
item.description: No. 1: Thomas expected to join Celtics for Game 3 -- By his own admission, Boston Celtics point guard Isaiah Thomas has dealt with the hardest week in his life. He flew home to the Seattle area after Game 2 to mourn with family over his younger sister's death in a car accident. As Game 3 of the Celtics' first-round series looms tonight (7 ET, ESPN), Thomas should be on the court come game time, writes Adam Forsberg of ESPN.com:

item.title: Kevin Durant optimistic of playing in Golden State Warriors Game 3 at Portland Trail Blazers
item.description: OAKLAND, Calif. -- Kevin Durant said he felt ready to play in Golden State's Game 2 playoff win a day earlier yet the Warriors opted to be cautious with their superstar as he nurses a strained left calf.

item.title: Fans rally behind Memphis Grizzlies and coach after ref rant
item.description: MEMPHIS, Tenn. -- Grizzlies coach David Fizdale provided Memphis fans a couple of new catchphrases from his ref rant after Game 2.

item.title: OKC Thunder needs Victor Oladipo to break out of slump
item.description: OKLAHOMA CITY -- Victor Oladipo knows the Oklahoma City Thunder need more offense from him, and Russell Westbrook's wingman is feeling the heat.

item.title: Utah Jazz need a big Derrick Favors vs. LA Clippers' duo of DeAndre Jordan and Blake Griffin
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY -- With no Rudy Gobert, the Utah Jazz are hoping it's Derrick Favors time.

item.title: Milwaukee Bucks introduce Toronto Raptors to "Barney" theme song
item.description: With a split in Toronto, the Bucks have given themselves a chance to win their first playoff series since 2001.

item.title: Cleveland Cavaliers star LeBron James reaches latest postseason milestones
item.description: It was an epic night for Cavaliers star LeBron James in many more ways than one.

item.title: Utah Jazz center Rudy Gobert out for Game 3 with left knee injury
item.description: SALT LAKE CITY (AP) -- Utah Jazz center Rudy Gobert will not play in Game 3 against the Los Angeles Clippers after hyperextending his left knee and suffering a bone contusion in the series opener.

item.title: Shootaround (April 20) -- Memphis Grizzlies, fans fired up for looming Game 3
item.description: No. 1: Fizdale's helping Memphis get fired up for Game 3 -- Memphis Grizzlies coach David Fizdale was issued a $30,000 fine by the NBA for his postgame rant about officials after Game 2. Memphis' players stepped up to pay that fine, but the words he used have set the stage for a wild Game 3 tonight, writes Geoff Calkins of The Commercial Appeal:
